item.title: Erlang and BEAM are the best.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title:
The limitations of current machine intelligence largely stem from seeking unified theories or trying to repair the deficiencies of theoretically neat but conceptually impoverished ideological positions.
Our purely numeric connectionist networks are inherently deficient in abilities to reason well; our purely symbolic logical systems are inherently deficient in abilities to represent the all-important heuristic connections between thingsâ€”the uncertain, approximate, and analogical links that we need for making new hypotheses. The versatility that we need can be found only in larger-scale architectures that can exploit and manage the advantages of several types of representations at the same time.
Then, each can be used to overcome the deficiencies of the others. To accomplish this task, each formally neat type of knowledge representation or inference must be complemented with some scruffier kind of machinery that can embody the heuristic connections between the knowledge itself and what we hope to do with it. - Minsky, 1991.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

The versatility that we need can be found only in larger-scale architectures that can exploit and manage the advantages of several types of representations at the same time.

Then, each can be used to overcome the deficiencies of the others. To accomplish this task, each formally neat type of knowledge representation or inference must be complemented with some scruffier kind of machinery that can embody the heuristic connections between the knowledge itself and what we hope to do with it. - Minsky, 1991.

item.title:
We solved one of our main bottlenecks in Concrete, the Rust like language we created with linear types and default concurrent tokio baked into the std. In about 3 months we should have interesting examples and relevant codebases to show to the community. Might take a little bit longer since we need more funding.
I honestly believe itâ€™s a way better Rust like language that is gonna be implemented in 20k lines.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: 1/ New AI research alert! The Meta Chain-of-Thought (Meta-CoT) framework helps language models reason more deeply by modeling how to think, not just what to think. A big step forward for AI problem-solving
item.dc:creator: @0xshai

item.title:
I like many ideas of Usual.
I highly dislike having a 4 year bond called USD something when itâ€™s not a stable coin. At minimum this is a huge mistake that confused people. If it was done by design itâ€™s criminal.
I also donâ€™t get why the USD0++ bond doesnâ€™t get yield.
I donâ€™t get why the oracle is pegged to 1 if by design itâ€™s a bond and not a stablecoin. Is this @MorphoLabs or @usualmoney fault? I honestly donâ€™t know and I want to learn about it.
The sad part is that I donâ€™t believe they did it on purpose (based on the information I have). I want to have a stablecoin that gives back to the users the yield it generates and a part to the owners of the token project. Like a decentralized Tether.

item.title: Culture wise I think we're the opposite of @gnosischain @gnosispay @GnosisDAO @safe @CoWSwap but I think these guys have created one of the best mafias in crypto. Amazing products.
